question_0.question: What is the purpose of the Nmfaf_3daDataManagement_Deconfigure service operation? [3GPP Release 18]
question_0.option_1: To configure the MFAF to map data or analytics received by the MFAF to out-bound notification endpoints
question_0.option_2: To configure the MFAF to stop mapping data or analytics received by the MFAF to out-bound notification endpoints
question_0.option_3: To supply data or analytics from the MFAF to notification endpoints
question_0.option_4: To fetch data or analytics from the MFAF based on fetch instructions
question_0.answer: option_2: To configure the MFAF to stop mapping data or analytics received by the MFAF to out-bound notification endpoints
question_0.explanation: The Nmfaf_3daDataManagement_Deconfigure service operation is used to stop mapping data or analytics received by the MFAF to one or more out-bound notification endpoints.

question_4.question: How does a supporting UE attach to the same core network operator from which it detached in a shared network? [3GPP Release 17]
question_4.option_1: It requests the core network node to remember its previous selection.
question_4.option_2: It uses information stored in the UE when it was detached.
question_4.option_3: It relies on the SIM/USIM card for information.
question_4.option_4: It performs a fresh attach procedure.
question_4.answer: option_2: It uses information stored in the UE when it was detached.
question_4.explanation: A supporting UE in a shared network attaches to the same core network operator it detached from by using information stored in the UE when it was detached.

question_11.question: When can the setting of the Privacy exception list be changed? [3GPP Release 17]
question_11.explanation: The setting of the Privacy exception list can be changed anytime.

question_12.question: What does the NEF notify to the AF after determining the suitable DNAI(s)? [3GPP Release 18]
question_12.option_4: DNAI(s) or the updated DNAI information
question_12.answer: option_4: DNAI(s) or the updated DNAI information
question_12.explanation: After determining the suitable DNAI(s), NEF notifies the DNAI(s) or the updated DNAI information to AF.

question_14.question: In online charging, how are chargeable events transformed into charging events? [3GPP Release 18]
question_14.explanation: The CTF transforms each chargeable event into a charging event and forwards these charging events to the OCF in real-time.

question_19.question: What is the purpose of the PSFCH channel in NR V2X sidelink? [3GPP Release 16]
question_19.option_1: To transmit Uplink and Downlink V2X messages
question_19.option_2: To transmit HARQ feedback for unicast and groupcast
question_19.option_4: To transmit physical layer structure information
question_19.answer: option_2: To transmit HARQ feedback for unicast and groupcast
question_19.explanation: The PSFCH channel in NR V2X sidelink is used to transmit sidelink HARQ feedback for unicast and groupcast services. It provides feedback on the success or failure of the whole transport block and triggers for channel state information (CSI) feedback.

question_23.question: Which feature proposes to integrate selected WLAN direct discovery technologies as an alternative technology for ProSe Direct Discovery? [3GPP Release 15]
question_23.option_2: Enhancements to LTE operation in unlicensed spectrum
question_23.explanation: The feature that proposes to integrate selected WLAN direct discovery technologies as an alternative technology for ProSe Direct Discovery is the WLAN Offloading System.

question_29.question: When can there be two N3 tunnel terminations at the RAN for a PDU Session? [3GPP Release 18]
question_29.option_1: When there are multiple PDU Session Ids for the PDU Session
question_29.option_2: When the QoS Flows of the PDU Session are split across the two RATs
question_29.option_3: When the PDU Session belongs to a specific Network Slice
question_29.option_4: When the Master RAN node is congested
question_29.option_5: When the Secondary RAN node is congested
question_29.answer: option_2: When the QoS Flows of the PDU Session are split across the two RATs
question_29.explanation: If the DL User Plane traffic of some QoS Flows of a PDU Session are directed to the Secondary RAN Node while the remaining QoS Flows are directed to the Master RAN Node, there will be two N3 tunnel terminations at the RAN for such PDU Session.

question_37.question: Which NGAP procedure is used for inter-system load balancing? [3GPP Release 17]
question_37.explanation: The NGAP procedure used for inter-system load balancing is Uplink RAN Configuration Transfer.

question_41.question: What is the purpose of the Validity Period for predictions? [3GPP Release 18]
question_41.option_1: To indicate the area of interest
question_41.option_2: To provide the Target of Analytics Reporting
question_41.option_5: To specify the maximum number of objects
question_41.answer: option_4: To define the time window
question_41.explanation: The Validity Period for predictions is used to define the time window for which the predictions are valid.

question_42.question: What is the purpose of the MCImp-MC_ARCH work item? [3GPP Release 14]
question_42.option_1: To specify a common functional architecture for MCVideo
question_42.option_2: To specify a common functional architecture for MCData
question_42.option_3: To specify a common functional architecture for all mission critical services
question_42.option_4: To specify a common functional architecture for MCPTT only
question_42.answer: option_3: To specify a common functional architecture for all mission critical services
question_42.explanation: The main objective of the MCImp-MC_ARCH work item is to specify a common functional architecture for all mission critical services.

question_45.question: What should the UE consider if it cannot detect any cell meeting the S criterion on a frequency for sidelink operation? [3GPP Release 17]
question_45.option_1: Out-of-coverage for sidelink operation on that frequency
question_45.option_2: Out-of-coverage for V2X sidelink communication on that frequency
question_45.option_3: Out-of-coverage for NR sidelink communication on that frequency
question_45.option_4: In-coverage for NR sidelink communication on that frequency
question_45.option_5: In-coverage for sidelink operation on that frequency
question_45.answer: option_1: Out-of-coverage for sidelink operation on that frequency
question_45.explanation: If the UE cannot detect any cell on a frequency meeting the S criterion, it shall consider itself to be out-of-coverage for sidelink operation on that frequency.

question_46.question: What is the purpose of the Member UE selection assistance functionality hosted by NEF? [3GPP Release 18]
question_46.option_1: To provide filtering criteria for AF's inputs
question_46.option_2: To collect corresponding data from relevant 5GC NFs
question_46.option_3: To select member UEs for AF's application operations
question_46.option_4: To provide QoS for the updated list of UEs
question_46.option_5: To assist the AI/ML application server in scheduling UEs
question_46.answer: option_3: To select member UEs for AF's application operations
question_46.explanation: The Member UE selection assistance functionality hosted by NEF is used to assist the AF in selecting member UEs that can be used in application operations such as AI/ML based applications.

question_49.question: When does the AMF enable or disable the 5G access stratum time distribution for a UE? [3GPP Release 18]
question_49.option_1: When UE is in CM-REJECTED state
question_49.option_2: When UE is in CM-IDLE state
question_49.option_3: When UE is in CM-REGISTERED state
question_49.option_4: When UE is in CM-DISCONNECTED state
question_49.option_5: When UE is in CM-CONNECTED state
question_49.answer: option_5: When UE is in CM-CONNECTED state
question_49.explanation: If the AMF receives start and stop times, it sends a message to the NG-RAN to enable or disable the 5G access stratum time distribution according to the expiry of start and stop times when the UE is in CM-CONNECTED state.

question_53.question: When can target UEs be positioned for lawful interception services? [3GPP Release 17]
question_53.option_1: Only if the target UE user authorizes it
question_53.option_2: Only if the privacy attribute value allows positioning
question_53.option_3: Under all circumstances required by local regulatory requirements
question_53.answer: option_3: Under all circumstances required by local regulatory requirements
question_53.explanation: Target UEs can be positioned for lawful interception services under all circumstances required by local regulatory requirements.

question_60.question: What are DCI formats with CRC scrambled by MCCH-RNTI or G-RNTI referred to as? [3GPP Release 17]
question_60.explanation: DCI formats with CRC scrambled by MCCH-RNTI or G-RNTI for broadcast scheduling PDSCH receptions are referred to as broadcast DCI formats.

question_70.question: What kind of access can enterprise UEs have to non-public networks? [3GPP Release 17]
question_70.option_1: Access to the non-public network of the enterprise only
question_70.option_2: Access to both a non-public network and a PLMN
question_70.option_4: Access to a PLMN and a non-public network via a different network
question_70.option_5: Access to a PLMN and a non-public network via multiple subscriptions
question_70.answer: option_2: Access to both a non-public network and a PLMN
question_70.explanation: Some enterprise UEs can be restricted to only access the non-public network of the enterprise, while others can access both a non-public network and a PLMN where specifically allowed.

question_73.question: What is the purpose of the TRP Measurement Grid? [3GPP Release 18]
question_73.option_1: To calculate the CDF of the EIRP/EIS distribution in 3D
question_73.option_2: To determine the total power radiated by the DUT in the TX beam peak direction
question_73.option_3: To determine the TX and RX beam peak direction
question_73.option_4: To perform TRP measurements taken on the sampling grid
question_73.option_5: To perform 3D Throughput/RSRP/EIS scans for RX beam peak direction
question_73.answer: option_4: To perform TRP measurements taken on the sampling grid
question_73.explanation: The TRP Measurement Grid is used to perform TRP measurements taken on the sampling grid to determine the total power radiated by the DUT in the TX beam peak direction.

question_74.question: What action is necessary to get access to services in Idle mode? [3GPP Release 17]
question_74.explanation: Camping on a cell is necessary to get access to services in Idle mode.

question_76.question: How does EC-GSM-IoT improve coverage performance for Cellular IoT devices? [3GPP Release 14]
question_76.option_3: By using modified channel coding schemes
question_76.answer: option_3: By using modified channel coding schemes
question_76.explanation: EC-GSM-IoT improves the coverage performance of Cellular IoT devices by using modified channel coding schemes.

question_80.question: What triggers the NF/NF Service Context Transfer Push procedure? [3GPP Release 18]
question_80.option_1: The Target NF/NF Service receiving a notification about the decommissioning
question_80.option_2: The Source NF informing the NRF about the decommissioning
question_80.option_3: The Source NF sending a request to the Target NF/NF Service
question_80.option_4: The Target NF/NF Service receiving a request from the Source NF/NF Service
question_80.option_5: The Target NF/NF Service setting up necessary information about the new context location
question_80.answer: option_3: The Source NF sending a request to the Target NF/NF Service
question_80.explanation: When triggered, the Source NF/NF Service acting as an NF Service Consumer sends its Context to the Target NF/NF Service acting as an NF Service Producer by sending a request.

question_87.question: Which 5G vertical domain is the maritime domain a part of? [3GPP Release 16]
question_87.explanation: The maritime domain is one of the 5G vertical domains in 3GPP.

question_96.question: What is the purpose of the User Configuration mechanism in the IMS Multimedia Telephony service? [3GPP Release 17]
question_96.option_1: To support synchronization of communication logs between multiple devices
question_96.option_2: To indicate which identities are active or inactive on a specific UE
question_96.option_3: To provide user preferences for media handling capabilities
question_96.option_4: To modify the Caller Identity Analytics function
question_96.answer: option_2: To indicate which identities are active or inactive on a specific UE
question_96.explanation: The User Configuration mechanism allows an authorized user to indicate which identities are active or inactive on a specific UE.

question_100.question: What is the purpose of packet buffering in Edge Relocation? [3GPP Release 18]
question_100.option_1: To prevent packet loss during EAS migration
question_100.option_3: To enable simultaneous connectivity over source and target PSA
question_100.option_4: To eliminate the need for EAS IP replacement
question_100.answer: option_1: To prevent packet loss during EAS migration
question_100.explanation: Packet buffering is used in Edge Relocation to buffer uplink packets and prevent packet loss when the application client sends UL packets to a new EAS before it is ready to handle them.

question_101.question: What does the Multi-Identity (MiD) service enable? [3GPP Release 16]
question_101.option_1: A user to use different UEs registered under different public user identities
question_101.option_2: A user to use different identities on a single UE
question_101.option_3: Call distribution to different members of a group or firm
question_101.option_4: A user to share identities with another user
question_101.option_5: A user to use different UEs that are registered under the same public user identity
question_101.answer: option_2: A user to use different identities on a single UE
question_101.explanation: The Multi-Identity (MiD) service enables a user to use different identities on a single UE.

question_108.question: What is the maximum number of PDU Sessions? [3GPP Release 17]
question_108.explanation: The maximum number of PDU Sessions is 256.
